summary: This document is an email chain from June 2021 between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, and an unnamed recipient (likely a Bureau of Prisons official). Sternheim complains about harsh and inconsistent conditions of Maxwell's pretrial confinement at the MDC, including guards disrupting her sleep, removing blankets, and creating a cold environment, as well as technical problems with attorney-client video calls. The correspondence reveals tensions between the defense and prison authorities.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, writing formal complaints to prison authorities about Maxwell's harsh treatment, poor conditions, and issues with attorney-client communication via video.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused, held at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). Her attorney alleges she is subjected to erratic, restrictive, and cold conditions, sleep disruption, and is experiencing health issues like sore throat and headache.

connections.description: Sternheim is the legal counsel for Maxwell, actively advocating for her client's welfare and proper pretrial conditions.

events.title: Sleep Disruption and Blanket Removal Incident
events.description: Around 1:00 AM, guards awoke Maxwell because her body was shaking, thinking she was having a seizure, but determined she was shivering from cold. At 3:00 AM, they disrupted her sleep again for the same reason. Guards later removed two of her blankets, claiming they were unauthorized.

events.title: Maxwell Reports Illness
events.description: Maxwell awoke with cold symptoms including a headache and sore throat. She was too exhausted to address her discomfort with medical staff when they visited.

events.title: Complaints About Guard Behavior and VTC Issues
events.description: Sternheim reports inappropriate guard behavior, including threatening discipline for minor infractions and laughing. She also complains that Video Teleconference (VTC) equipment has blurry video, broken audio, and blacks out, disrupting attorney-client communication.

locations: New York, NY 10011 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney alleged that guards at the MDC were purposely disrupting Maxwell's sleep and removing her blankets, leaving her shivering in a cold cell.
The attorney claimed Maxwell was experiencing health issues (sore throat, headache) and was too exhausted to speak with medical staff.
Technical problems with Video Teleconference (VTC) equipment were severely disrupting attorney-client communication and trial preparation.

The defense characterized Maxwell's pretrial confinement as 'the most unique, restrictive, and invasive conditions' and blamed the MDC/BOP for erratic enforcement of rules by revolving teams of guards.
